intro: Oribasia longiflora, commonly known as the longflower oroblanco, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and grasslands, and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its long, narrow leaves and showy yellow flowers make it a distinctive species in its habitat. Oribasia longiflora is often found in sandy soils and is considered a valuable component of desert ecosystems.
